Chapter 2 Change file names This function gets a list of all .csv files in the directory and creates a data frame with these file names. It modifies the file names according to the specified conditions, and finally, renames the files in the directory with the new names. modify_file_names <- function() { # Define files # Get a list of all .csv files in the current directory files_dir <- list.files(pattern = "\\.csv$") # Create a data frame with the file names files_dir_df <- data.frame(A = files_dir) # Create a new list of file names with modified names # If the non-digit characters in the file name are 1, prepend '00' # If the non-digit characters in the file name are 2, prepend '0' # Else, leave the file name as is files_dir2 <- ifelse(nchar(gsub("\\D", "", files_dir_df$A))== 1, gsub("(^[^.]*)","00\\1", files_dir_df$A), ifelse(nchar(gsub("\\D", "", files_dir_df$A))== 2, gsub("(^[^.]*)","0\\1", files_dir_df$A), gsub("(^[^.]*)","\\1", files_dir_df$A))) # Rename the files in the directory with the new names file.rename(files_dir_df$A, files_dir2) } # Call the function # modify_file_names()
